conclusion: Car A drives in from the group of blocks on the right. The task is to determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will eventually stop, considering power, collision, and deflection effects.
The image shows a green surface with multiple colored blocks arranged in a cluster. Car A is positioned on the right side of the image, moving toward the cluster of blocks.
The cluster of blocks includes orange, light-green, yellow, blue, red, and purple cubes, with varying sizes and positions.
Car A will strike the orange block that is just to the right of the gap in the front row.
Because the impact is off-centre and A has much more forward momentum than any of the small cubes, the orange cube will be driven toward the upper left part of the cluster.
The orange cube will bump lightly into the light-green cube behind it.
The collision robs Car A of nearly all of its speed.
After the hit, Car A rotates slightly clockwise and rolls only a few centimetres farther.
Car A comes to rest almost exactly where the orange cube had been.
